text: Harold George Howe (6 October 1906 – 27 April 1976) was a professional footballer from Hertfordshire, England. Howe was one of Hemel Hempstead's first professional footballers. He started his playing career with Apsley and signed professional forms for Watford at the age of 20. At the height of his career, he played for Queens Park Rangers and later Crystal Palace. After a spell with Rochdale, he finished his playing career with Tunbridge Wells Rangers in the Southern League. After retiring from football, Howe remained a keen sportsman taking up golf and darts. He became a prominent darts player winning the News of the World individual area championship. ==References== Category:1906 births Category:English footballers Category:Tunbridge Wells F.C. players Category:Watford F.C. players Category:Crystal Palace F.C. players Category:Queens Park Rangers F.C. players Category:Rochdale A.F.C. players Category:1976 deaths Category:Association footballers not categorized by position
title: Harold Howe
